file_content.text: Sorry to see you go, Captain. You made Voss almost interesting.
Welcome back, Captain. Me and you seem to have a lot of friends in common.
My contacts would not risk hiding me. They say this man knows you.
Does Jela live?
Jela won't be bothering your family again.
She's dead.
Thank you.
By the end, I had her begging on her knees.
You should have seen it.
I'd have paid good credits to watch that catfight.
Are we here just to gossip?
What do you want?
I will not see Rogun send another Jela to control us. Would you take our trade instead?
There's a no-brainer.
Isn't that what you just went through a whole trial to prove yourself innocent of?
It is a risk.
Those beasts are the one thing of worth on this world.
Ouch. That'll be a slap in the face for Rogun.
You have shown you care more for us than Rogun ever did.
I don't need the hassle. You want to say thanks, I'll take it in cash.
Just pay me now.
We have no need for credits here. Take all I have.
The Voss know all about you. You need to lie low.
The Voss will shut you down.
This is not the time for the final war with the Voss. We will not risk it.
I should return to my family. Thank you for their lives.
You can run this through Darmas Pollaran, at Port Nowhere.
I take a sixty percent cut.
If he has buyers, we can supply.
I'd rather you than Rogun see the profits.
You got an interesting way of doing business. You ever want to set up on Voss, look no further.
I did not think to be so long.
My wife says I changed. She sends me to the shrine to be cleansed of your influence.
I know she is right when I weep at the thought of your leaving.
You belong here, Lokir. I never will.
Go back to your wife.
You don't need to be cleansed. We haven't even done anything dirty yet....
[Flirt] Then don't go.
"Love is water. On the lips, it quenches. On the skin, it caresses. When cold, it pierces. When in every breath, it kills."
I never understood how such words were worth the shame.
You're not seriously thinking...? Because he quoted poetry?
I could do that! I just have to... read some.
Of course. This is your husband. Who else would venture into such dangers?
I have no husband. Ignore him.
Corso's just a friend.
Lokir, we both have people to go home to.
He's right. I can't do this.
Well, good, then. I was worried there.
"Love is the bolt fired in darkness, which knows not what it slays."
I would lose my family to keep you.
I pray the Mystics might heal my heart.
I need some time alone.
Corso, get out of here.
Alone? Alone, I wouldn't worry about.
You know he's going to be nothing to you. You'll leave him here and slink back to the ship and expect me to be there waiting.
May not always be the case.
It is not only my wife's heart we break.
Never figured you'd go for the swoony romantic type, but whatever jumps your ship.
Poetry! Argh! Why didn't I think of that?
Not again....
The ones who put such store by chastity always fall the hardest.
Oh, it's worth the shame. It's worth lots and lots of shame.
Come closer.
It is dangerous for you outsiders, to spread ecstasy so freely.
Consider this our parting gift to each other.
You know I can't stay.
I treasure it.
If I'm ever on Voss again, we should get together.
Yeah, it was fun.
I cannot imagine your world.
Believe me, that was not worth getting this worked up about.
Give me a break.
I cannot regret this.
I will go to my grave with this memory.
I hate wimpy men.
Stop whining.
My wife is right. You cannot know an outsider.
You've got a way with men, my friend. Remind me to keep this platonic.
I wish you a future of clear vision and strong will.
I will not be the same.
Good luck to you, friend.
What is it?
I heard you finally got your say with the high muckymucks, and I wanted to suggest you stop by after.
There's, ah, "outstanding business" we ought to settle up before you go offworld.
Until you get this thing with the commandos straightened out, I don't know you.
If you make it back alive, you'll have to tell me what it's like. I've never had the guts to try it....
Zak is your best shot at finding Jela, and this is a chance to take him by surprise.
Load me in.
This plan is crazy-smart.
I'm not going to end up a statue in Gormak city hall, right?
You're sure carbonite is safe?
The man I got the unit from said he used this exact trick to get into a Hutt's private stash.
I can't believe I'm even considering this.
So many things could go wrong.
There's a shipment leaving today. If you're not on it, you may miss your chance.
You sent her here? Why not just lead the blasted commandos to my doorstep?
You sent him to me? You think I want a bunch of Voss commandos here?
I said the captain is innocent. They said I believe a lie.
Well, don't shove her off on....
Well, don't shove him off on....
Hey...! How long you been there? Let's get you out of my shop before anyone comes looking.
You'd better not be thinking "throw me to the Sarlacc to save yourself."
You got a plan?
I'd considered it.
What did the commandos say?
Tell me what happened.
I'm not feeling the love here.
Watch yourself, Scratch.
Shark's gotta swim.
Jela laid her groundwork well. The adjudicators believe you lead the smuggling ring.
The manhunt will continue secretly, to avoid alerting accomplices.
They haven't told Senator Dodonna, at least...?
How secretly?
You've got a good thing with her, eh?
How do we prove Rogun's the one behind this?
I need to clear my name.
Rogun's death gets slower and more painful every minute....
I'm going to kill Rogun.
To clear your name, you must catch Jela Reneke trading with Gormak.
She and that creepy Zak guy are the only ones the Gormak don't shoot on sight.
They both have their own hideouts down in Gormak lands, but there's no easy way to get there.
Does that mean there's an insanely hard way?
No "easy" way, huh?
I'm not letting Rogun just get away with this.
Doesn't matter. I'm going.
I'm not afraid of Gormak.
We have fought the Gormak for a hundred generations. They are millions.
If they wish to hide these criminals, they will.
There are options, Captain--but you'll want to think them over carefully and pick your favorite. We might be a while, Lokir.
I've been trading with Gormak Zak and his people on the side. I could send you with their next shipment.
We'll need to be dead.
Are you saying we need to be dead?
Bowdaar is not dying today!
We need to be dead? That's your plan?
Um, uh, okay... but if we have no life signs, wouldn't that mean we're dead?
You must be dead.
I'm pretty sure I heard that wrong.
What's this about dying?
I'm not saying you have to be dead--just sleeping really hard.
All right. Let's hear this wacky scheme....
This ought to be fun.
If I'm dead, I don't get to laugh at Rogun's funeral.
No way.
It is a sound plan.
I've got equipment here to freeze you in carbonite and then release you on a timer. You'll thaw out inside Gormak Zak's home base.
Tell Scratch your decision. I must speak with the adjudicators.
I'm not getting between you and the Voss.
To keep this out of sight of the Voss commandos, we set up shop in the heart of the Gormak war zone.
I'll transmit the coordinates now. If you make it here alive, I'll be waiting.
I awaited you in Voss-Ka for hours. You were seen everywhere else!
If you do not check in, duty requires I accompany you.
Sorry. I was just finishing up a job for your buddy, Scratch.
I was on my way.
You never told me to come back.
You didn't say to check in.
I am honores.
I cannot guard Voss from your influence if you deal in secret.
I work alone.
Forget that, pal.
Not on Voss.
What have you learned?
Scratch hooked me up with Rogun's suppliers. I'll be posing as a buyer.
I have a meeting set.
I'll bring you the people who are trafficking with Gormak, but you need to let me work my way.
Trust me.
Face it, Lokir. There's things you Voss are good at, but dealing with scum ain't your strength.
I'm not telling you anything.
Back off.
Scratch?
Sorry, Captain. I like you, but not enough to risk the sweet spot.
I set him a meet. Woman named Jela Reneke, deals in abominations. Captain's going to pose as her buyer.
A buyer? Of Gormak abominations?
Rogun's people wouldn't be fool enough to expose themselves to the Voss.
The captain's word is good; we're putting these folks out of commission.
Rogun's men do not trust easily.
It does seem like a lot of bother just to kill someone.
Don't worry. The captain won't actually buy one--what would we feed it?
All due respect, Lokir, sometimes you gotta be scum to catch scum.
I will not interfere unless you break Voss law. But I will come.
You can help me find this place.
Great. Come along.
You start lecturing, and you'll blow the whole deal.
That's a terrible plan.
It'll kill the whole charade if Rogun's people see a Voss tagging along. Lokir, you need to hang back. Let the Captain go first.
Agreed. Where?
If I have to drag you along, you'd better be able to defend yourself.
I'm not responsible for you.
According to Jela's transmission, it's near the pilgrim route. Looks like a risky neighborhood.
Even the Mystics dare that not.
My life is yours to guard.
I have your artifacts.
Your rep don't lie, do it? I'll get you Jela on the link--she's Rogun's lady-in-charge.
Jela, I got your buyer here. Full up. This sale goes through, tell Rogun those credits got my name on them.
I assume he means you? Then I warn you, this is a unique opportunity. There's nothing like these creatures for sale in the galaxy.
Just tell me where to pick up the cargo.
I'm good for it.
Be careful, I drive a hard bargain.
[Flirt] Let's haggle.
I'm counting on it.
Says who?
I'm Jela Reneke. Any more than that, I don't say on an open link.
Show me the goods, I'll show you the credits.
I don't buy blind.
I'll let you two work this part out yourselves.
You understand this is large and unusual cargo with certain... transportation issues.
Selling it is a capital offense on Voss. You have to buy direct and pick it up yourself.
Where are we going? Heart of an active volcano? Irradiated wasteland? Rancor throat?
It's never easy, is it?
Just tell me where.
I won't turn down a chance to meet in person.
[Flirt] I look forward to it.
Then I hope you make it here alive.
You want this sale, we meet where I say.
I'll set the location.
Then we lose the sale. This isn't negotiable.
Bring back the artifacts and we'll talk.
You're the "distinguished guest" Lokir was on about? Ha.
Let me guess--I seen some familiar faces here I wasn't expecting when my ship put down.
I trust it's Rogun setting shop here that brought you, not a sudden yen for enlightenment?
So you know something about Rogun that's worth knowing?
Good guess.
Couldn't tell you why Rogun's people came here, but I can get you to who's in charge.
I know people who know people, see?
What can I do for you?
Are you Exchange?
Who do you work for?
Wrong way of thinking--you're on Voss now. Don't matter what you were before.
It's the free market here. So tell me what you're looking to buy.
Just tell me who's dealing for Rogun. I can do the rest.
Point me to Rogun's people.
I can do you one better.
I'll give you cash for each of Rogun's lackeys you kill.
I want Rogun's people dead.
You've got me confused with someone who likes pain.
I can't go that far, Captain, but I got a proposal.
Do me a little service, and I can set you up legit as a buyer for Rogun's a-boms. See the whole operation from the inside.
I assume you're not offering anything for free.
What'll it cost me?
What'll it cost to get what I need and keep your mouth shut about it.
What are you charging?
You know, Captain, after a few months on Voss, you've got no idea how refreshing that is.
As it happens, I got a small service needs doing.
You help me out, I can get you set up as a buyer for Rogun's a-boms.
Are we talking about the same thing here?
A-boms?
The Gormak beasts, right? The ones they've teched out? Locals call 'em abominations, but that's a mouthful.
What's the service?
Rogun keeps tight reins on his buyers, but I can get you in. It's the only way you'll see his people face-to-face.
But first, I got a buyer myself. Looking for some one-of-a-kind artifacts only found in the very dangerous ruins out there, if you hear me.
Won't be the first dangerous ruins I've been in.
Tell me where to go.
I hear, I hear.
You're my only option.
No reason to take that attitude. This could work out for both of us.
I don't know much about Voss. What's valuable?
What kind of artifacts?
Jedi and Sith will both pay big for anything you dig up in those ruins.
If it gets me to Rogun, I'm in.
Done.
I got a buyer, call him a collector, wants some hard-to-find artifacts known to be in the Voss ruins.
But it's strange stuff down there. Monsters you might say, and worse. This planet's got something seriously wrong with it.
But you take the specs I'm transmitting, you bring me back something that looks right, I'll hook you up with Rogun's folks. Trust me.
Thank you. Those who live, live because of you.
Stop Jela. Those she leads turn into ones like this.
By a strange coincidence, that's just what I was planning....
Of course.
Sounds like you're in the market for a new distributor....
Make it worth the risk.
You wish Rogun's place? It is done.
I don't work with Rogun's people.
I don't trust you.
Well, that's not exactly true....
Rogun is no one to me.
If you want my loyalty, you have it. Everything I gave to Rogun goes to you.
In Jela's lair, you can learn her plans. Destroy the followers she corrupted.
Can I hope Jela isn't very popular?
How many followers?
She took many. I don't know who survived.
But there is a back entrance. I will give you passcodes to her rooms.
I'm not putting myself on the line for something you won't do yourself.
Are you going to help?
I will help. I will give you passcodes to Jela's rooms.
Talk with the wretched Voss when you are done. They already man a path to the Nightmare Lands.
I will seek shelter with the Exchange. While I'm here, my family is still a target.
You...!
I offer peace.
Forgive me. I did not know what Jela intended. Though I would not have opposed her then.
You were helping Jela try to get me executed. What's changed?
Forgive you?
Surrender and maybe we'll talk.
Hands in the air!
I am at your mercy.
Ooh. I think my stomach is still in Voss-Ka.
I feel sick.
Clever trick. If Jela was here, it would have killed you.
Jela has gone too far.
I came to this world to help Rogun. Now the Gormak are my family. I will do nothing to hurt them.
You're not both working with the Gormak? That'll make Lokir's day.
Jela's hurting the Gormak?
If you want her dead, point me to her.
Where is Jela?
I cannot track her.
Jela has turned her back on both Rogun and us.
Gormak do not need lies.
Rogun did well for my people. He brings new weapons, new food. But Jela goes behind his back.
She is trading with Sith. And they demand what all Gormak are forbidden.
Because Voss commandos and giant cyber-monsters weren't enough....
Of course there'd be Sith....
The Sith asks us to operate on the beasts of the Nightmare Lands.
What are Gormak forbidden to do?
Forbidden?
No Gormak enters the Nightmare Lands.
Lokir-Ka said the Gormak are hardly more than animals.
How can you live like this?
He is Voss. He follows the Mystics. It is their darkness that creates the Nightmare Lands.
The creatures there are twisted mutants. The Sith will only trade for them. We refused.
But they said the mutants would be powerful weapons with our tech. Jela agreed.
You need protection? Is that what this "let's be friends" thing is about?
That's why you need my help?
Yes.
I don't want to see what the Sith could do with living weapons.
We need to stop her.
The Nightmare Lands have existed as long as this world.
Everything that walks into the darkness is consumed, body and mind.
Those Jela took with her were corrupted... changed... destroyed. They are no longer Gormak.
Oh-oh-oh!
Just tell me where.
I don't trust you.
Nightmare Lands?
Get them!
I was lying. There's only one way to get at Jela--but Lokir wouldn't be happy if he knew what I'm doing.
Hey, whatever works.
It is rather ingenious.
Your plan is already terrible.
If you survive, you'll have a great story to tell.
Spit it out, already.
The thing is, Gormaks scan for life-forms before they let any supplies in.
You'll have to be sort of... not alive.
Go into my carbon freezing chamber and activate it whenever you're ready. I'll bundle you inside Gormak Zak's supply shipment.
Find yourself an escort to those coordinates and give the Captain room to work. Good luck, you two.
